Settings.Name: TFQ
Settings.Description: Controls texture filtering optimizations exposed by CCC.

Settings.Name: CatalystAI
Settings.Description: Controls app detect and image quality altering optimizations exposed by CCC.

Values.Description: Always run the preamble cmd stream
Only run the preamble cmd stream when necessary

Settings.Name: ForcePreambleCmdStream
Settings.Description: Controls whether the preamble command stream for a Queue is always submitted or skipped when the same scheduler context runs back-to-back on the CP ring.

Settings.Name: MaxNumCmdStreamsPerSubmit
Settings.Description: Controls the maximum number of command streams that can be submitted at once to the kernel. Overrides the kernel maximum value if set to a value > 0.

Settings.Name: RequestHighPriorityVmid
Settings.Description: Requests that contexts be created with high priority VMID to reduce page table invalidation penalties.

Settings.Name: RequestDebugVmid
Settings.Description: Requests that contexts be created with a debug VMID. This allows for better shader debugging by keeping the page tables valid after the context has been switched out.  This is also useful for SQTT profiling as it ensures both compute and graphics queue work will share the same VMID allowing the thread trace to be filtered to a single VMID (to avoid capturing other processes work) while still capturing all work by the target process. NOTE: RGP tracing automatically requests the Debug VMID during setup so there is no need to change this setting when capturing RGP traces.

Settings.Name: NeverChangeClockMode
Settings.Description: Disables setting GPU clocks in the driver (eg. during profiling). Enable this if using AGM to force clock values

Values.Description: Instructs the driver to use all RBs
Driver will choose an optimal value
Instructs the driver to use this exact number of RBs

Settings.Name: NonlocalDestGraphicsCopyRbs
Settings.Description: Specifies the number of RBs used in a graphics copy to nonlocal destinations.  Reducing the number of RBs can increase PCIe throughput.

Values.Name: IfhModeDisabled
Values.Description: IFH is disabled

Values.Name: IfhModePal
Values.Description: IFH is implemented in PAL (kernel is not called)

Values.Name: IfhModeKmd
Values.Description: IFH is implemented in the kernel

Settings.Name: IFH
Settings.Description: Controls Infinitely Fast Hardware (IFH) mode. See IfhGpuMask for which ASICs are affected (default all)

Settings.Name: IdleAfterSubmitGpuMask
Settings.Description: Idles after each call to Submit for the GPU's specified by the bitmask. GPU's are specified by the position in the bitfield and map to the LDA chain array.  Example: 0x2 would cause the GPU corresponding to the 2nd LDA chain in the array (array position 1) to idle after each submit.

Values.Name: TossPointNone
Values.Description: Normal operation, toss point is disabled

Values.Name: TossPointAfterRaster
Values.Description: Kill Rasterizer

Values.Name: TossPointWireframe
Values.Description: Force Wireframe fill mode

Values.Name: TossPointBackFrontFaceCull
Values.Description: Force back and front face culling

Values.Name: TossPointAfterSetup
Values.Description: Scissor-out all geometry

Values.Name: TossPointDepthClipDisable
Values.Description: Force Depth-clipping disabled

Values.Name: TossPointAfterPs
Values.Description: Disable Color Buffer writes

Values.Name: TossPointSimplePs
Values.Description: Use a trivial Pixel Shader

Settings.Name: TossPointMode
Settings.Description: Toss points enables stripping out of GPU work for more focused performace analysis. This setting controls which work will be tossed.

Settings.Name: ForceFixedFuncColorResolve
Settings.Description: This setting forces MSAA color images to always prefer fixed function resolves over any other resolve method (if FixedFunc resolves are supported by the image). This will override the client's preferred resolve method

Settings.Name: UnboundDescriptorAddress
Settings.Description: 64-bit address to use for unbound descriptors. This will show up in the faulting address if a page fault is triggered due to an unbound descriptor in an application.

Settings.Name: ClearAllocatedLfb
Settings.Description: Clears local frame buffer to zero. The allocated local frame buffer is not cleared to zero on Linux.  Applications sometimes assume that the driver will clear the framebuffer on Linux (which would match Windows behavior).

ValidValues.Description: Bitmask values that correspond to image types for controlling 4kB swizzle modes.
ValidValues.Name: Addr2Disable4kBSwizzle

Values.Name: Addr2Disable4kBSwizzleDepth
Values.Description: Depth images

Values.Name: Addr2Disable4kBSwizzleColor1D
Values.Description: 1D Color images

Values.Name: Addr2Disable4kBSwizzleColor2D
Values.Description: 2D Color images

Values.Name: Addr2Disable4kBSwizzleColor3D
Values.Description: 3D Color images

Settings.Name: Addr2Disable4KbSwizzleMode
Settings.Description: Bitmask of surface types which should not allow 4kB swizzle modes for chips which use AddrMgr2.

Settings.Name: Addr2DisableXorTileMode
Settings.Description: Whether to disable XOR tile modes.

Settings.Name: OverlayReportHDR
Settings.Description: Determines if the developer mode overlay will report information about HDR mode.

Values.Name: OptNone
Values.Description: Disable all pipeline optimization

Values.Name: OptTrimUnusedOutputs
Values.Description: Trim unused shader outputs (which allows dead-code removal to trim unused Shader inputs as well, and bubble-up to all pipeline stages)

Settings.Name: WholePipelineOptimizations
Settings.Description: Selects which methods of whole-pipeline optimizations are enabled. 0x1 - Trim unused Shader outputs (which allows dead-code removal to trimunused Shader inputs as well, and bubble-up to all pipeline stages).  By default, only the removal of unused shader outputs is performed.

Settings.Name: ForceHeapPerfToFixedValues
Settings.Description: If set we will use a set of hard-coded heap performance values instead of the usual ASIC-specific values.  This setting is intended for bring-up testing as we will return zeros for all performance data on unknown GPUs.  This can cause strange behavior (e.g., poor performance) in some applications.

Settings.Name: CpuReadPerfForLocal
Settings.Description: CPU read performance for local memory

Settings.Name: CpuWritePerfForLocal
Settings.Description: CPU write performance for local memory

Settings.Name: GpuReadPerfForLocal
Settings.Description: GPU read performance for local memory

Settings.Name: GpuWritePerfForLocal
Settings.Description: GPU write performance for local memory

Settings.Name: GpuReadPerfForInvisible
Settings.Description: GPU read performance for invisible memory

Settings.Name: GpuWritePerfForInvisible
Settings.Description: GPU write performance for invisible memory

Settings.Name: CpuWritePerfForGartUswc
Settings.Description: CPU write performance for GartUswc memory

Settings.Name: CpuReadPerfForGartUswc
Settings.Description: CPU read performance for GartUswc memory

Settings.Name: GpuReadPerfForGartUswc
Settings.Description: GPU read performance for GartUswc memory

Settings.Name: GpuWritePerfForGartUswc
Settings.Description: GPU write performance for GartUswc memory

Settings.Name: CpuReadPerfForGartCacheable
Settings.Description: CPU read performance for GartCacheable memory

Settings.Name: CpuWritePerfForGartCacheable
Settings.Description: CPU write performance for GartCacheable memory

Settings.Name: GpuReadPerfForGartCacheable
Settings.Description: GPU read performance for GartCacheable memory

Settings.Name: GpuWritePerfForGartCacheable
Settings.Description: GPU write performance for GartCacheable memory

Settings.Name: AllocationListReusable
Settings.Description: Re-use allocation list across submissions in Linux. This will improve CPU performance of command buffer submission, but will potentially cause GPU memory de-allocation to be delayed.

Settings.Name: FenceTimeoutOverride
Settings.Description: Timeout value to override app-specified value for fence timeouts.  This setting is meaningless if the app specified zero seconds.  A value of zero here means to use the app-specified timeout value.  Useful on HW simulation where working cases can result in false timeouts.  Value specified in seconds

Settings.Name: UpdateOneGpuVirtualAddress
Settings.Description: If set, when calling RemapVirtualMemoryPages(), PAL will only do one unmap/map protect operation at a time, instead of trying to group the operations by BaseAddress.  This affects WDDM2 only.

Settings.Name: AlwaysResident
Settings.Description: All allocations will be permanently kept resident without management by the client with AddGpuMemoryReferences.  This may reduce the runtime overhead of submission on Linux, but won't work properly if the application overcommits the available GPU memory.

Settings.Name: DisableSyncobjFence
Settings.Description: Disable Fence based on Sync Object. Force use Timestamp Fence. By default Fence type is selected according to the system configuration.

ValidValues.Description: Defines the supported VM always valid modes.
ValidValues.Name: VmAlwaysValidEnable

Values.Name: VmAlwaysValidForceDisable
Values.Description: Force the optimization always disabled

Values.Name: VmAlwaysValidDefaultEnable
Values.Description: Only enable the optimization when kernel driver can support

Values.Name: VmAlwaysValidForceEnable
Values.Description: Force the optimization always enabled

Settings.Name: EnableVmAlwaysValid
Settings.Description: With this feature enabled VM addresses are always valid within the local VM context.  This eliminates the need to add private memory into the resource list. This may reduce the runtime overhead of submission on Linux, but won't work for memory shared by multiple processes.

Settings.Name: DisableSyncObject
Settings.Description: Disables SyncObject support for semaphores which means semaphores will be based on ProOnly or Legacy interfaces according to the system configuration.

ValidValues.Description: Defines the supported command buffer dump modes.
ValidValues.Name: CmdBufDumpMode

Values.Name: CmdBufDumpModeDisabled
Values.Description: Command buffer dumping is disabled

Values.Name: CmdBufDumpModeRecordTime
Values.Description: Dumping is enabled at command buffer record time

Values.Name: CmdBufDumpModeSubmitTime
Values.Description: Dumping is enabled at command buffer submit time

Settings.Name: CmdBufDumpMode
Settings.Description: Determines if dumping is enabled, and whether it is at record or submit time.

ValidValues.Description: Defines the supported formats for command buffer dumping.
ValidValues.Name: CmdBufDumpFormat

Values.Name: CmdBufDumpFormatText
Values.Description: Command buffers are dumped in plain text.

Values.Name: CmdBufDumpFormatBinary
Values.Description: Command buffers are dumped in raw binary mode.

Values.Name: CmdBufDumpFormatBinaryHeaders
Values.Description: Command buffers are dumped in binary mode with PM4 headers.

Settings.Name: CmdBufDumpFormat
Settings.Description: Controls the format of command buffer dumps.

Settings.Name: CmdBufDumpDirectory
Settings.Description: Relative directory where command buffer dumps are placed. Relative to the path in the AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable. If that env var isn't set, the location is platform dependent.

Settings.Name: SubmitTimeCmdBufDumpStartFrame
Settings.Description: The starting frame to start dumping command buffers.

Settings.Name: SubmitTimeCmdBufDumpEndFrame
Settings.Description: The ending frame to stop dumping command buffers.

Settings.Name: LogCmdBufCommitSizes
Settings.Description: Controls whether command stream commit sizes are logged to a file.

Settings.Name: LogPipelineInfo
Settings.Description: Enables Pipeline Logging

Settings.Name: PipelineLogConfig

Structure.Name: LogInternal
Structure.Description: Contols logging of internally generated pipelines (i.e. RPM pipelines, etc

Structure.Name: LogExternal
Structure.Description: Contols logging of externally generated pipelines (i.e. the application's pipelines

Structure.Name: LogShadersSeparately
Structure.Description: If true, each shader in a pipeline will be logged to a separate file on disk. Otherwise the whole pipeline is placed in a single file

Structure.Name: LogDuplicatePipelines
Structure.Description: If true, duplicate pipelines will be dumped to a file with a numeric suffix attached to the filename to distinguish each copy of the pipeline.

Structure.Name: EmbedPipelineDisassembly
Structure.Description: If true, disassembly information will be embedded into compiled ELF binaries.

Values.Name: PipelineLogFilterNone
Values.Description: Do not disable logging based on pipeline type.

Values.Name: PipelineLogFilterCs
Values.Description: Disable logging for Cs pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineLogFilterNgg
Values.Description: Disable logging for NGG pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineLogFilterGs
Values.Description: Disable logging for Gs pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineLogFilterTess
Values.Description: Disable logging for Tess pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineLogFilterVsPs
Values.Description: Disable logging for VsPs pipelines

Structure.Name: PipelineTypeFilter
Structure.Description: Bitfield which allows for filtering pipeline logging to exclude specific pipeline types.  If a bit is set then that pipeline type will NOT be logged.  The bits are defined in the ValidValues array.

Structure.Name: PipelineLogDirectory
Structure.Description: Relative directory where pipeline information logs are placed. Relative to the path in the AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable. If that env var isn't set, the location is platform dependent. Each unique pipeline is in a separate file within that directory. The log name is based on a hash of the pipeline's create info and which shader stages are active.

Settings.Description: Pipeline Logging configuration options

Settings.Name: CmdStreamReserveLimit
Settings.Description: Specifies how many DWORDs of command space is reserved by ReserveCommands(). This will be clamped by each CmdStream to their CmdAllocator's chunk size.

Settings.Name: CmdStreamEnableMemsetOnReserve
Settings.Description: If true, the command stream will memset all command space to CmdStreamMemsetValue. This will only function on debug builds.

Settings.Name: CmdStreamMemsetValue
Settings.Description: If CmdStreamEnableMemsetOnReserve is true all command space will be memset to this value. This will only function on debug builds.

Settings.Name: CmdBufChunkEnableStagingBuffer
Settings.Description: If true, each command chunk will allocate a system memory staging buffer. Commands will be stored in this buffer until the chunk is finalized.

Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorFreeOnReset
Settings.Description: If true, each command allocator will free its command chunk allocations when the client calls ICmdAllocator::Reset() even though this behavior is against the rules of the DX12 specification.

Values.Name: Pm4OptDefaultEnable
Values.Description: Only enable optimizations when the app specifies the CMD_BUFFER_OPTIMIZE_GPU_SMALL_BATCH command buffer build flag.

Values.Name: Pm4OptForceEnable
Values.Description: Force optimizations always enabled.

Values.Name: Pm4OptForceDisable
Values.Description: Force optimizations always disabled.

Settings.Name: CmdBufOptimizePm4
Settings.Description: Controls fine-grained optimization of each command buffer's PM4 stream. Can improve performance of CP-bound applications that have CPU cycles to spare.

Values.Name: Pm4OptModeImmediate
Values.Description: When commands are written to the command stream's reserve buffer.

Values.Name: Pm4OptModeFinalized
Values.Description: When a command stream's command chunks are finalized.

Settings.Name: CmdBufOptimizePm4Mode
Settings.Description: When PM4 optimization is enabled this setting controls when command streams will use the optimizer.

Values.Name: CmdBufForceOneTimeSubmitDefault
Values.Description: No override, use app's preference.

Values.Name: CmdBufForceOneTimeSubmitOn
Values.Description: Force CMD_BUFFER_ONE_TIME_SUBMIT always on.

Values.Name: CmdBufForceOneTimeSubmitOff
Values.Description: Force CMD_BUFFER_ONE_TIME_SUBMIT always off.

Settings.Name: CmdBufForceOneTimeSubmit
Settings.Description: Globally overrides the CMD_BUFFER_ONE_TIME_SUBMIT command buffer building flag.

Values.Name: CmdBufPreemptModeDisable
Values.Description: Command buffers will not be preempted but our queues support preemption.

Values.Name: CmdBufPreemptModeEnable
Values.Description: Command buffers may be preempted if KMD reports support.

Values.Name: CmdBufPreemptModeFullDisableUnsafe
Values.Description: PAL pretends KMD doesn't support mid-command buffer preemption. This can hang or corrupt other drivers. It must only be used for debug.

Settings.Name: CmdBufPreemptionMode
Settings.Description: Controls to what degree command buffers support mid-command buffer preemption.

Values.Description: PAL will dump CE RAM using a postamble command stream whenever either MCBP is enabled or the client enables the 'persistent CE RAM' feature.
PAL will dump CE RAM using a postamble command stream whenever the client enables PAL's 'persistent CE RAM' feature. (Typically only DX9P will do this).

Settings.Name: CommandBufferForceCeRamDumpInPostamble
Settings.Description: Toggles whether or not PAL should add a postamble to universal Queue submissions to dump CE RAM whenever MCBP is enabled.

Settings.Name: CommandBufferCombineDePreambles
Settings.Description: Combines the DE per-submit and per-context preambles into one per-submit preamble.

Settings.Name: CmdUtilVerifyShadowedRegRanges
Settings.Description: If true, PAL will verify that all register writes in command buffers are properly shadowed when mid command buffer preemption is enabled. This can have a noticable impact on CPU performance. This setting is ignored in release builds.

Values.Name: Default
Values.Description: PAL will enable optimizations when generally efficient.

Values.Name: Disabled
Values.Description: Disable all optimizations that could be detrimental in special cases.

Values.Name: MinKernelSubmits
Values.Description: Minimize the overhead of launching command buffers on the CPU and GPU.

Values.Name: MinGpuCmdOverhead
Values.Description: Minimize the overhead of reading command buffer commands on the GPU.

Settings.Name: SubmitOptModeOverride
Settings.Description: If non-zero, it forces all SubmitOptModes to a specific value. 0: No Override 1: SubmitOptMode::Default 2: SubmitOptMode::Disabled 3: SubmitOptMode::MinKernelSubmits 4: SubmitOptMode::MinGpuCmdOverhead

Values.Name: TileSwizzleNone
Values.Description: Disable tile swizzle for all surfaces.

Values.Name: TileSwizzleColor
Values.Description: Enable tile swizzle for renderable color targets.

Values.Name: TileSwizzleDepth
Values.Description: Enable tile swizzle for renderable depth-stencil targets.

Values.Name: TileSwizzleShaderRes
Values.Description: Enable tile swizzle for shader resources.

Values.Name: TileSwizzleAllBits
Values.Description: Enable tile swizzle for all surfaces.

Settings.Name: TileSwizzleMode
Settings.Description: Bitmask which enables bank & pipe tile swizzling for surfaces.

Settings.Name: EnableVidMmGpuVaMappingValidation
Settings.Description: On WDDM2 platforms, PAL is able to send a set of flags through to the kernel which can control how the KMD handles each GPU VA mapping when reserving VA space, mapping VA space or updating the GPU page mappings. If this setting is true then PAL will request that extra validation is performed to ensure that every GPU virtual address mapping to a specific physical allocation specifies a matching set of these KMD flags.

Values.Name: Addr2PreferredDefault
Values.Description: Do not request a specific swizzle type preference.

Values.Name: Addr2PreferredSW_Z
Values.Description: Prefer ZOrder swizzle (ADDR_SW_Z).

Values.Name: Addr2PreferredSW_S
Values.Description: Prefer Standard swizzle (ADDR_SW_S).

Values.Name: Addr2PreferredSW_D
Values.Description: Prefer Display swizzle (ADDR_SW_D).

Values.Name: Addr2PreferredSW_R
Values.Description: Prefer Rotated swizzle (ADDR_SW_R).

Settings.Name: Addr2PreferredSwizzleTypeSet
Settings.Description: Sets a preferred swizzle type when using AddrLib2.

Settings.Name: PipelinePrefetchEnable
Settings.Description: If true, attempt to prefetch pipeline shader code and data into L2 before executing the pipeline.

Settings.Name: ShaderPrefetchClampSize
Settings.Description: When this setting is non-zero, clamp shader prefetching to this many bytes.

Settings.Name: MaxAvailableSgpr
Settings.Description: Artificially limits the maximum number of SGPRs available for shader compilation. A value of zero disables the limit and HW defaults are used.

Settings.Name: MaxAvailableVgpr
Settings.Description: Artificially limits the maximum number of VGPRs available for shader compilation. A value of zero disables the limit and HW defaults are used.

Settings.Name: MaxThreadGroupsPerComputeUnit
Settings.Description: Controls how many CS thread-groups are allowed to launch per compute unit.  This throttles the shader, which can sometimes enable more graphics shader work to complete in parallel. A value of zero disables limiting the number of thread-groups to launch.  This field is  ignored for graphics shaders.

Settings.Name: MaxScratchRingSize
Settings.Description: Controls the maximum size of the scratch ring allocation. If the application requests more scratch memory than this, the driver will limit the number of waves in flight to comply with the memory restriction.

Settings.Name: IfhGpuMask
Settings.Description: Mask of the GPUs to have all submits dropped. See IFH setting for IFH mode that will be applied. If the bit is set, the GPU will have its submits dropped.

Settings.Name: HwCompositingEnabled
Settings.Description: Enables support for the HW compositor (crossDisplayPresent) if the hardware supports HW compositing.

Settings.Name: MgpuCompatibilityEnabled
Settings.Description: Enables support for MGPU in PAL. If MGPU Compatibility is disabled, all GPUs will still be exposed to the application, but no MGPU-specific compatibility flags will be returned.

Settings.Name: PeerMemoryEnabled
Settings.Description: Enables support for peer memory and peer memory transfers if the hardware is capable.

Settings.Name: ForcePresentViaGdi
Settings.Description: Forces the present technique to use the GDI BLT path.

Settings.Name: PresentViaOglRuntime
Settings.Description: When true window mode present path will go through OpenGL runtime. When false window mode present path still go legacy DWM API path.

DefinedConstants.Name: MaxPathStrLen
DefinedConstants.Description: Maximum string length for a directory/path setting

DefinedConstants.Name: MaxFileNameStrLen
DefinedConstants.Description: Maximum string length for a filename setting

DefinedConstants.Name: MaxMiscStrLen
DefinedConstants.Description: Maximum string length for a miscellaneous string setting
